intro: Hieracium lycopifolium subsp. bifrons, commonly known as the bifrons hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. The subspecies bifrons is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
